DOC.brief_summary: This study aim test hypothesis dietary intake phosphatidylcholine ( PC ) lysophosphatidylcholine ( LPC ) acutely alters plasma lysophosphatidic acid ( LPA ) level autotaxin activity normal weight obese subject .
DOC.detailed_description: Lysophosphatidic acid ( LPA ) simple glycerophospholipid find biologically-relevant level plasma important effect isolate culture blood , vascular fat cell . The main enzyme responsible generation plasma LPA secrete lysophospholipase D , autotaxin ( ATX ) . Adipocytes contribute substantially plasma ATX level . The investigator demonstrate rapid production metabolism plasma LPA animal . More recently , investigator observe plasma LPA level increase mouse fed high fat ( `` Western '' ) diet comparison level find mice feed normal chow . The investigator also find diet-induced obesity increase circulate ATX level mouse . The investigator hypothesize diet , particular dietary phosphatidylcholine ( PC ) , may regulate autotaxin substrate lysophosphatidylcholine ( LPC ) , LPA derive . Obesity may amplify response increase plasma ATX level and/or activity . The current study test whether dietary PC normal weight obese subject acutely alters LPA level autotaxin activity .
